VegDescription: The peat bog forest stand included mainly pines (Pinus sylvestris) and birches (Betula pubescens), with spruce (Picea obovata) undergrowth. VegDescription: Lowland Swamp. In the cover of sedges (Cyperus), reedgrass,Bulrush,meadowsweet, Comarum palustre, Menyanthes trifoliate, bog horsetail, shoots of wild rosemary. In the forest stand on the swamp is dominated by birch (Betula pubescens), rarely pine (Pinus sylvestris), spruce (Picea), alder gray (Alnus inkana), willow (Salix). On the island pine and single Larix.
Worker1_Address1: Botanical garden of the Ural division of the Russian Academy of sciences. Sverdlovsk region, Yecaterinburg, 8 Marta str., 202A. 620130

VegDescription: Swamp transitional — pine shrub-positive. In the cover of Eriophorum vaginatum, Ledum palustre, Chamaedaphne calyculata, rarely — Oxycoccuspalustre, Vaccinium vitis-idaea, Rubus chamaemorus, Comarum palustre, Equisetum palustre, Dryopteris sp., Mnium sp., Polytrichum commune. The forest stand is dominated by pine with birch  admixture, on the outskirts-pine with birch and spruce admixture (Picea obovata)
